College student arrives to mow the lawn
1.content:
Thirty-eight year old Calvin Powell and Thomas Lane, his 26-year-old lover, had been together for the past three years. They had recently taken a cruise to celebrate their third anniversary together.

Calvin worked as a pharmalogical research scientist for an international conglomerate that marketed everything from new medical breakthroughs to the latest fashionable cosmetics.

He was currently investigating some reported side effects from a new brand of skin moisturizer developed by the firm's cosmetics division.

He often brought his work home with him. He was a nervous, compulsive man. He wasn't very tall, only about five feet seven. But, he had a nice body and short dark hair. He had brown eyes.

His partner, besides being 12 years younger, was a tall, muscular man with sandy blond hair and green eyes. He stood 6'2" tall. He had a slender waist and broad shoulders.

In most situations, Thomas was an easy-going, carefree individual. He worked as a photographer, which allowed him to explore his artistic range but yielded only sporadic paying jobs. Still, with Calvin's work in research, they maintained a comfortable home in the suburbs where Calvin liked to garden on the weekends and Thomas would photograph different aspects of the garden.

One Saturday morning found Thomas indulging his latest passion, extreme close-up photographs of blossoms and tiny subjects, such as the bugs and other creatures he found in Calvin's garden.
He had just finished photographing a fuzzy caterpillar munching along one of Calvin's prize lilies when his lover exited the house.

"I've got to run into the lab for a few hours, hon," Calvin said. "Want me to pick up something for dinner?"

Thomas, hunched over his camera, said, "Sure, whatever you want, Cal."

Calvin reached out and snatched an ant that he found crawling on his lover's shirt collar. "What was that?"

Calvin flicked the tiny bug into the air to fall somewhere in his carefully tended garden.

"Nothing." he said. "You just had a bug crawling on you."

Thomas shivered. "Yes, I know. This garden's full of bugs."

"It's nature," Cal retorted.

"Well, as long as it leaves me alone, I'll leave it alone," Thomas said, screwing closed the lens cap of his camera. "But, all the weird bugs do make great photo subjects."

Calvin laughed and gave Thomas a quick kiss. "Have a good afternoon," he said as he departed.

A few minutes later, Thomas returned indoors. He went to the kitchen to wash his hands. As he did so, he noticed a tube of moisturizer on the kitchen table. He looked at his hands, which were looking a little chapped. He had been rooting around in the flowerbeds to get just the right composition for his photos. He decided his hands could stand some soothing lotion.

He took the tube and squirted some of its contents into his hands. He worked the lotion over his fingers, the back of his hands and his palms.
Although he didn't need to worry about his appearance, he did so. He liked to keep himself perfectly groomed and in good shape.

As he finished with the lotion, he felt an odd tingling in his fingers. Nothing unpleasant. Just a mild itch.

He didn't think any more about it.

Until...
1.title: Typical Saturday

11.content:
"Thomas".

"Hunh?" The sound of seagulls and the crashing waves outside wafted into the room, and the salt air tickled his nose. The warm sunlight felt good on his face, and he was having a very good dream when he awoke to Calvin's hand on his shoulder.

" Come on, sleepy head." Calvin placed a mug of hot coffee on the nightstand, which Thomas' head happened to be facing. The not disagreeable mixture of salt air and a fresh cappucino began to work their magic. A broad smile began to cross his lips, even though his eyelids remained defiantly shut.

A second later he let out a slow groan and stretched in the bed. He swallowed, then inhaled sharply. He opened his eyes to see Calvin wearing a white bathrobe looking down at him lovingly.

"It's almost 10 am"

"10 am? I thought we were on vacation."

"We are, sweetums." Calvin leaned over and kissed his boyfriend tenderly on the lips. "You are so cute when you first wake up".

Calvin sat down and began brushing Thomas' bangs with his fingers slightly. "The sunrise was beautiful this morning. There were these fish that jumped way up high out of the water, and the way the light played on the ripples they made was just magical. I wish you could have seen it".

"Just my luck to have fallen in love with a morning person." Thomas placed back of his left hand dramatically against his forehead and struck the cheesiest pose he could manage. Calvin chuckled softly. Thomas' absurdist flair was one of the things Calvin loved about him.

"Well, sunny boy, it's time for you to get dressed" Calvin kissed his lover's forehead and grasped his hands, pressing them against the young man's chest.

"If you insist". They kissed, and Calvin stood up again and walked to the window while the younger man pulled the sheets aside and placed his feet on the hardwood floor. He reached over and grasped the coffee mug with his hands, feeling the warmth spread from his palms into his hands. He took a long, slow slurp, swallowed, and let out a small grunt of satisfaction.

Life had been good to them. Calvin's job paid well, and the older man was feeling more confident lately, now that his work was beginning to gain some recognition in the scientific community. Thomas didn't know much about what it was that his boyfriend did exactly. While Calvin was always enthusiastic when he asked for explanations, Thomas never really quite got his head around all that scientific mumbo-jumbo. He'd listen respectfully, nod, and occasionally let out an "uh-huh" to show that he was listening, but he really didn't care much about the technical aspects of Calvin's job.

Calvin was saying something about the small shops along the boardwalk by the beach, when Thomas looked at the floor. He noticed that while the ball of his foot rested against the smooth floor, the heels didn't quite reach. That's odd, he thought. He didn't remember the bed being set that high off the ground.

Eh. He shifted his weight and slid down off the bed, He started walking toward the bathroom and rubbed the sleep from his eyes.

............................................................................

Calvin made the bed and laid out a few clothes for his sweetheart. The younger man brought out his nurturing side, He worried sometimes that Thomas might take offense,. But if he did, he never showed it. In fact, he seemed to like it when Calvin mothered him. He wondered to himself what Thomas must have been like as a kid growing up.

Thomas towelled off and came into the bedroom. He started to dress. He sat down on the edge of the bed and pulled his shoes on. Tying the laces, he stood up and took a few steps toward the door when he tripped on the legs of his jeans,, which seemed baggier than usual.

Calvin noticed, and commented
11.title: The Condo by the Ocean

111.content:
Thomas stopped and faced the full length mirror by the dresser. His clothes hung loosely on him, his jeans riding low on his waist. His T-Shirt seemed baggy, and hung lower than he'd remembered. That's funny, he thought. This shirt used to fit me.

"I guess so." he said, adding emphasis on the final o. He turned around slightly, examining himself. He wondered if maybe it was because he hadn't worked out in a while. He hadn't lost his appetite, as his stomach's soft growl in anticipation of breakfast attested to. Maybe the jeans were someone else's that got left in the dryer in the laundry room downstairs. They looked the same as the ones he usually wore. The tag in the back was even worn in the same places.

He'd have to start excercising more when he got home, he said to himself. At least he wasn't getting fat.

............................................................................

On his way home from work, he stopped into the clinic, Thomas dropped by the mall to pick up some new clothes. He'd been working out religiously for months now, and while he looked muscular in the mirror, his clothes had continued their cruel expansion over his frame. He tried not to think about what it could mean. He quietly hoped to himself that it wasn't and STD. He and Calvin had been faithful to each other, and they had both tested negative for the usual things doctors test gay men for consistently as long as they had been together. He had an appointment to see his doctor tomorrow, and he looked forward to the event with a sense of impending doom. As he tried on some new clothes in the changing room, he found that he now wore a size 16 1/2, a full size smaller than before. His waist had also shrunk down to a size 32,. He nervously picked up a packet of undershirts in a medium and headed for the checkout counter.
....................................................................

The next 10 days were nerve wracking. The doctor told him that he didn't have HIV, and that was a relief. But something was making him lose body mass. He asked the doctor if maybe it was cancer. His doctor had scheduled an appointment at the oncologists, to reassure him, but said that it was extremely unlikely. When the nurse took Thomas' height and weight he noticed something disturbing on the chart. He used to be 6' 2" tall. Now, his chart read that he was 5'11'. He'd commented on this, to which the nurse replied that the cartiliage in the spinal column sometimes compressed over the course of the day, due to gravity pressing down on the fluid filled sacs between the vertabrae. The result is that a person is a little taller when they first get up than at the end of the day. This seemed plausible enough. The doctor had ordered a battery of blood tests and urine samples to be sent up to the lab. In a week and a half, they'd know more, and the appointment with the oncologist was scheduled for a few days after that.

As Thomas left the clinic, and walked to his car he stopped to think. It's 9:30 am. I only got up a little while ago. Would my spinal column have shrunk that much in this short a time? He reached around with one hand and ran his fingers against his back, feeling the spaces between the bones nervously. He kept walking to the car, too afraid to think about anything.

...........................................................................< br />
Weeks passed, and he began to feel like a human pincushion. Calvin took time off work to accompany him to the doctor, and held his hand, which after a while had begun to shake like a leaf. The doctor's visits weren't doing anything to help, and in the meantime, the insurance company had begun to complain about the lack of any specific diagnosis. Thomas began to suggest going to an acupuncurist or trying an Naturopath. Calvin had a scientists mistrust of quackery, but he also wanted to reassure his boyfriend that everything was going to be okay. Besides, he too had begun to grow tired of not knowing what was happening. He reached over to embrace his lover, and stopped he he realised something terrible.

Thomas used to tower over Calvin. Now they could wear the same clothes. He said nothing, for fear of upsetting him further, but the knowledge of this shook him at his core.

.....................................................................

"God, I can't drink this stuff anymore!"

Thomas made a disgusted face and hacked a little.

"Is that the stuff you got from the Chinese Herbalist?"

"Yeah, and it tastes like shit!"

"What is that stuff, anyway?"

"I don't know exactly. Powdered deer antlers or something like that."

"Is it helping?"

"See for yourself. I've been the same size for a month now. It tastes awful, but I've stopped shrinking."

Thank god for that, Calvin thought. The doctors still hadn't reached any conclusion as to what was wrong with Thomas. It had been 3 months since this whole sordid adventure had begun, and the insurance company had cut them off. One of the physicians had suggested they participate in a research study, but the idea of using Thomas for a lab rat scared Calvin even more than his loss of size. In the span of the last three months, Thomas had begun to wear a boy's XL. His waist was now a svelte 29", and he stood around 5'5", slightly smaller than Calvin.

Calvin walked over and hugged Thomas closely. He kissed the young man and patted him slightly on the back. I love you so much, he thought. You're still my man, even if you're a little different now. "I've been loving you a little too long to want to stop now, angel.", he said. "Thick or thin, we'll always be together."

"Thomas. closed his eyes. He held on to Calvin tightly and rocked slightly in his arms. Though his world was falling apart, at least he had Calvin there to help him through it. And for that reason, he was the luckiest man alive.

"Honey?"

"Yeah?"

"Will you marry me?"

Calvin started to cry a little. he choked slightly, but managed to let out a reply in a nervous voice.

"I do".

Thomas started to sob, and he grabbed Calvin more tightly than before. They looked at each other for the first time , each one nervous and happy and confused. They started to laugh and cry at the same time, and then Thomas let out a little whoop while Calvin shouted, "We're getting married!"

Thomas stopped, and looked at Calvin with an intense stare.

"If I start shrinking again, will you still love me?"

"I wouldn't care if you were as small as a baby, I'd love you with everything I've got."

"Do you still think I'm sexy?"

"Baby, you're the hottest man alive"

Thomas reached over and began to undo the buckle of Calvin's belt with a smile on his face. Calvin relied by pulling his lover's shirt up over his head. They undressed each other with the slow certainty of two pilgrims taking the first steps toward the holiest adventure of them all. They kissed, deeply, arms around each other, rigid cocks pressed against each other's hard stomachs, throbbing with the same thunderous rythm that now compelled them to dance that strange dance that requires no other music.

............................................................................

"Are you sure?"

"Of course I'm sure".

It had been two months since the wedding, and they were both looking in the mirror.

"I noticed it when I was walking home from the gym. These kids were playing in the park and one of them came running up to me and asked me what grade I was in. I thought he meant what grade did I teach, but he looked at me funny when I told him I wasn't a teacher."

"Oh, honey, you always did look young for your age".

"Not that young"

"It's not that bad. We'll go get you some new clothes, and..."

"Calvin, I wear a boys' size 12-14 and it's loose on me.. These jeans are practically falling off of my waist. There's only so many more sizes left to shrink down to"

He started to sob a little. This brought out Calvin's nurturting insticts, and he patted Thomas on the back

"There, there. I'm here, baby"

"Stop that!", Thomas choked on a sob "Stop calling me baby! Pretty soon I'm going to look like one, and I don't need you to remind me of that with your stupid...." The words died on his lips.

"I'm sorry, honey. I just don't know what to do."

"This is so unfair"

He hated the sound of his piping voice.

He had lost his job because of this, and the money was getting tight. Calvin could support the both of them, but the money wasn't in infinite supply, and all those alternative medical practitioners weren't a cheap. The herbs had stopped working, and the future was looking very very bleak.

Calvin held him close, and pressed his head into his chest. Thomas pulled away.

He said
111.title: Changes

choices: The story is a sensation, and Thomas becomes a star
The story is a sensation, and Calvin and Thomas lose their privacy
A national disaster occurs, and the story is lost and forgotten
1112.content:
It had been a week since Thomas first suggested he go on TV. Calvin was of course opposed to the idea, afraid of what would happen seeing his boyfriend become a national spectacle, a freak. But Thomas was determined. The two argued all that day, and Thomas eventually stormed out the door.

Calvin didn’t know what happened to Thomas. For days, he heard no word from him. Not from any of his friends, nor the doctors at the clinic.

Then, last night, Thomas called him. “Babe, I’m so sorry to run out on you like that.”

“It’s okay, I’m just glad you’re okay and safe. Where are you?”

“I’ve been staying with Ted, my old agent. You know how he’s always been something of a father figure for me. Also, he’s been very helpful…”

“Helpful? How so?”

“Don’t get angry. But, we’ve gone ahead and made some arrangements.”

“What kind of arrangements?” Calvin was trying to hold back the anger he felt last week. He had never really trusted Ted, and was not happy that he had returned to their life.

“Tomorrow, we’re holding a press conference. We’re gonna tell the world what’s happening to me. The doctors and scientists will be there, and we’ve already lined up a ton of reporters and TV stations.”

“Babe, are you crazy? They’re gonna call you a freak, they’re gonna… You gotta cancel this!”

“It’s too late. The story’s already leaked. And the news will report on me and my condition, no matter if I show or not.”

Calvin was silent. After a few moments, Thomas continued, “Babe, don’t be angry. It will be okay.” He was nearly sobbing, “Besides, I need you. I need you to be there with me. I need you to support me during this.”

Calvin choked up, hearing his husband sound so vulnerable. Reluctantly, he gave in.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------


It was now the morning of the press conference, and Calvin found shivers run through him as he stood outside the news building where the conference would be held. He checked in, and was directed to wait in a nearby room.

“Babe, you came!” he heard a familiar voice cry out as he opened the door.

Thomas ran over to him, and embraced him. Calvin wrapped his arm around his lover. He felt so small, he realized, even though he didn’t seem that much smaller than when last they had seen each other.

When they broke the embrace, Calvin stepped back and took a good look at Thomas.

“5-foot-3,” Thomas said preemptively, and a little uncomfortably. “Well, 5-foot-2 and 3/4."

“No, no, that wasn’t what I was thinking…. going to ask…” Calvin said, even though he had been thinking about it. “I’m just… I’m just… Wow, babe, you look… hot!”

Calvin stared at his lover. Thomas was wearing an immaculately tailored summer suit that managed to show off his narrow waist and still broad chest. He had a button-down shirt, with the top few buttons unbuttoned, exposing his bronze tan, and pec cleavage. In addition, he was incredibly coiffed and styled. His hair had been trimmed and slightly dyed, exposing new highlights. His face was absolutely unblemished. And, Calvin even though he might be wearing some makeup.

Thomas laughed, and spun around. “You like? Ted thought I should get really spiffed up. He said the more hunky I look, the more sympathetic I’d appear. And, the more marketable I’d be for news stories and interviews. He hired a tailor and stylist and...”

“Marketable?”

“Well, yeah. Babe, you know we’re low on money, especially with me out of work… But, with a story as wild as mine, we gotta cash in on this while we can.”

“But, won’t we be making money today, from all the press…”

“Today? No, today we make nothing. You don’t get paid for press conferences. Ted says, we do the press conference today, then wait for the offers for exclusives to come in.”

Calvin shook his head, confused, worried. “You mean it won’t stop?” Calvin worried if they’d have privacy again.

Thomas grabbed Calvin’s hand. “Babe, don’t worry. It will be okay…”

There was a knock on the door, as a man Calvin had met some time ago entered. It was Ted, Thomas’s agent and manager. It had been a couple years since Calvin last saw Ted, not since Thomas had given up fitness modeling. Ted himself had been a model in his youth, and though nearing 50, still maintained the rugged, chiseled look and youthful energy from his past. At 6’4”, he towered over the two men, and when he spoke to them, he did so condescendingly.

“Ah, Calvin, you made it. Good! This will be very good for today’s conference. The American public likes a good domestic story. They like to see not just the news figures, but the men and women behind those figures…”

Calvin had always hated the way Ted spoke. It was like dirty, filthy, greed just seemed to stream from his mouth. “Well, I’m hear to support Thomas.”

“Support? Of course. Though if you really want to support him, make sure you play it up a bit, okay?”

“Play it up?”

“Yeah, give details, jazz it up, play the emotions. What was it like seeing your giant hunk of a man become smaller than you? What has this done to your relationship? How does it make you feel that you are inadvertently responsible for this?”

“Now, wait a minute!” Calvin said, getting furious.

But Thomas stepped in quickly, “Hey now, Ted. That’s too much. You know just as well as I do that this was an accident. Don’t go pissing off my man…”

“Sorry, got a little caught up. You know me, Tommy. Just want to make my clients get big. Real BIG.... Oh, sorry for the choice of words…”

Calvin was really beginning to steam, and even Ted realized he had stepped too far.

“Hey, how about I wait outside the room, leave you two alone? I’ll knock a couple times when we’re ready for you. Should be not much longer, half hour or so.” Without even waiting for a reply, Ted quickly stepped out of the room.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------

The press conference was a whirl. Though a complete nightmare for Calvin, it was amazing how quickly it all went by.

Both Calvin and Thomas were amazed at how many showed up. Evidently, Ted did a great job wrangling reporters.

There were cameras and microphones everywhere. And voices and questions. Thomas at first was intimidated, especially being in a room surrounded by so many people so much taller than him. But once he sat down and the questions began, he calmed down, and was a natural. He was eloquent and honest and ridiculously telegenic. Calvin sat next to him, mostly silent, and strangely turned on by this side of Thomas he had never seen.

Doctors and scientists also were there, discussing theories and discoveries and fears. The crowd gasped when it was revealed Thomas was already almost a foot shorter than his normal height. And they sighed sadly when they had heard that what seemed like a recent cure was no longer working.

There were questions, questions galore. But Ted stepped in, and stopped the conference early. He really wanted to whet their curiosity. Make them hunger for more. Soon, he ushered the Thomas and Calvin out of the room. Thomas looked anxious, like he was upset to leave. But then soon quieted.

And then, just a half hour later, both men were in Calvin’s car, heading home to await the response.
1112.title: Taking Thomas's story public

Thomas doesn't want to lie down.
112.content:
Thomas tugged at his jeans, noticing how loose they seemed to be. And long too!

"Weird... They must have stretched in the wash or something," Thomas said to Calvin. "You bought me these jeans."

"I don't remember buying jeans that big for you, " Calvin replied. "They must be at least a 36x36."

Calvin tugged at Thomas' jeans from behind to look at the tag. The tag read 32x34.

"Huh... You must be losing weight.. The jeans are your size after all," Calvin commented.

"Weird, I haven't changed my diet and exercise lately..." Thomas replied.

Thomas looked at himself in the mirror. Sure enough the jeans looked a few sizes too big. But they were longer than usual as well. Thomas looked like one of those teens trying to pull off the baggy pants look. Except it just looked ridiculous on him being an adult and all. He never liked that new style. Thomas and Calvin didn't really say much more about the baggy jeans and continued their day.

They weren't really going anywhere for vacation, but they were enjoying having the time off to just relax. Calvin went out into the garden to water, weed, and get a few things done, while Thomas took pictures of bugs in the garden as well as Calvin working in the garden. It was a hot, sunny day, and Calvin and Thomas were feeling parched after their hard work and from being outside.

"Want a cold glass of water?" Thomas inquired to his sweaty lover working away in the garden. "I could use one myself, so I'll go get us each one, ok?"

"Sure!" Calvin beamed. "So thoughtful of you!"

Thomas rushed inside, and opened the cupboard to reach for the cups. Wait... Reach? He almost had to stand on his tip toes to grab cups today. Usually he is almost eye level with them! He set the cups on the counter and grabbed the water pitcher out of the fridge. It seemed heavier than normal. It was quite full. But he didn't remember it ever being this heavy. Thomas carefully poured each glass full of water and set the water pitcher back in the fridge. He made his way outside, a glass of water in each hand. Why did the glasses even feel heavier than usual?

As he made his way to Calvin, he noticed that his feet seemed to have more room in his shoes. He had almost reached Calvin when he tripped on his own jeans again. Falling forward, he lost a shoe as he tripped, and the glasses of water went flying, and shattered on the ground right in front of him. Calvin helped Thomas up off the ground. Looking at Thomas as he helped him up, Calvin noticed that the jeans Thomas wore appeared to be even longer now. The cuffs of his jeans dragging on the ground. Calvin helped Thomas bunch up the jeans around his ankles so that he wouldn't trip again. Calvin noticed Thomas' socks appeared to be loose as well as his shoes appearing too big. Calvin noticed he was also now eye level with Thomas, when he had to look up to him before.

"I don't feel so good," Thomas says, once he brushed himself off from tripping. "What's happening to me?"

"I could be seeing things, but it looks to me like you're getting shorter..." Calvin replied. "Let's get you inside sweetie. You should lie down..."

"Okay, sure..." Thomas said.

"People don't just shrink!" Thomas thought to himself. "It's physically impossible, there must be another explanation..."

122.title: Four inches

1221.content:
Calvin's cat swatted at him.

Tiny Thomas felt the claws rake the air mere inches from his shrunken body. He turned and ran, which only triggered the monstrous felinge's chase instinct.

He heard the fearsome animal closing behind him and scanned desperately for a place to hide and avoid the scary monster.
1221.title: Calvin's cat caught him

12213.content:
The cat opened its mouth and quickly swallowed him.

He was so small it took a single gulp, with the mixed good fortune of avoiding the cat's sharp teeth.

He cried "Noooh!" as he felt the brief plunge into the cat's stomach.

"Oh shit! I've been swallowed by the cat!"

The feline, happy with an unexpected snack, exited the house through the pet door. In the backyard, though, it feel a tickle that soon rose to the level of major irritation.

Soon, it was hacking up a furball, which provided Thomas with an unlooked for reprieve.

After the cat coughed him up, it grew distracted and ran away, leaving one tiny human huddled in a disgusting mess in the enormous backyard.
12213.title: Ate him

choices: Adrenaline lets him push through into the backyard
1222.content:
The meow from behind him took him by surprise. He felt his blood turn cold facing a feline many times the size of the largest tiger or lion.

"Dammit, what's the cat doing inside?" He knew that Calvin was always letting the cat sneak indoors, despite Thom's allergies.

Of course, a few sniffles were now least of his worries.

The cat meowed again and crept forward.

Thom shrieked and fled, but soon realized he was running blindly, with no objective. He needed to find a hiding place.

He looked over his shoulder, and saw the cat racing to catch up.

He saw only one possible way to save himself. He needed to exit the same way the cat entered — through the swinging pet door.

Thom ran to the swinging strip of plastic, but when he pushed against it, the barrier didn't budge.

"No! It's too heavy!"

He turned just as the cat swiped a massive paw at him.
1222.title: Calvin's cat chased him

12221.content:
He dodged the swipe of the giant paw, which smacked the flimsy plastic strip serving as the pet door. A desperate Thomas threw himself against the door, using the momentum from the cat's swipe to push through to the other side.

He ran, gradually coming to a stumbling halt, on a well-worn gravel pathway, surrounded by tree-sized bedding plants and shrubs.

He whispered to himself something about not being in Kansas any longer. He looked over his shoulder, checking to make certain the cat hadn't followed him. He breathed easier when the enormous feline didn't come crashing through the door. The cat would likely find a quiet spot in the house for a nap.

"I just have to wait for Cal to get home and get me out of this mess," Thomas said aloud in the vastness of the backyard.
12221.title: Other Side of the Door

choices: Thomas agrees to a fling with the postman
Darrell wants to dominate the little white guy
Before he can decide, he shrinks down to one foot tall

Before he can decide, he shrinks down to four inches tall
13.content:
As he finished with the lotion, he felt an odd tingling in his fingers. Nothing unpleasant. Just a mild itch.

Thomas didn't think much more about the tingling, which had slowly spread from his fingers to his hands and arms. He grabbed a towel in the kitchen and rubbed some of the lotion from his hands, but the itchy tingling continued to spread.

Distracted by a knock at the back door, he tossed the towel back onto the kitchen counter. He opened the door and welcomed Darrell, the attractive, young postal carrier who made almost daily visits to their household to deliver parcels from the laboratory to Calvin.

"It's another delivery for Cal," Darrell said. The young black man filled out nicely the standard blue and white uniform of a U.S. postal employee.

"Thanks for bringing it to the door," Thomas said, but as he reached for the package, he stumbled. "Whoa! Feeling a little dizzy."

An instant later, he felt Darrell catch him in two strong arms. "Yeah, you're getting a little unsteady on your feet, big guy."

Thomas felt like a telescoping effect as his body seemed to contract rapidly, creating the illusion that Darrell and the kitchen were growing swiftly larger.

Before Darrell's astonished gaze, the tall, muscular, blond man quickly shrunk.

In less than seconds, Thomas lost at least half of his six foot-two inch height. The now three-foot-tall man, swimming in his oversized clothing, raised his eyes to gaze up at a very impressive-looking Darrell.

"Oh my god!" Thomas exclaimed, noticing the newly-acquired high pitch of his voice. "You look 12 feet tall!"

"What's happening to you?" Darrell asked. He had let his bag of letters and other mail slide down to the floor.

Thomas felt the tell-tale tingling renew with vigor. "No! It's happening again!"

When another 12 inches melted from his frame, his clothing simply collapsed around him. He stood barely even with Darrell's shins.

"Call Calvin, please," he piped up as he struggled in the heap of collapsed attire.

Darrell, trying to react with a calmness he didn't truly feel at the moment, went on reflex when he reached down and placed his hands beneath the little man's arms and lifted him out of the clothing.

"What are you doing?" Thomas protested as he felt the huge man lift him free of his boxers and jeans. He kicked his small legs in the air as Darrell lifted him with no more effort than he would have needed for a toddler.

"Put me down! Over there, on the counter."

Darrell followed the instructions, but even seated with his bare butt on the kitchen counter, Thomas found himself level with the giant man's waistline.

Darrell felt warring emotions, one being shock.

But, as he felt himself stirring in his pants, he recognized the other. He felt a lusty wave of desire as he stared at the much-reduced little man left helpless in his control.

"Fuck, you look...you look so..."
